sen.j: 葛城襲津彦（かつらぎ の そつひこ、曽都毘古・沙至比跪、 生没年不詳、4世紀後半～5世紀前半頃?）は大和国葛城地方の古代豪族葛城氏の祖として『記紀』に記されている。
sen.e: KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko (his first name is written as 襲津彦[Sotsuhiko] as well as 曽都毘古[Sotsuhiko], and it is also written as 沙至比跪 with the reading 'Sachihiko': year of birth and death unknown, attributed that he lived during the latter fourth century to the early fifth century) is in a figure that appears in "Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as the ancestor of an ancient local ruling family called Katsuragi clan, which existed in the Katsuragi region, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 葛城襲津彦（かつらぎ の そつひこ、曽都毘古・沙至比跪→KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko (his first name is written as 襲津彦 [Sotsuhiko] as well as 曽都毘古 [Sotsuhiko], and it is also written as 沙至比跪 with the reading 'Sachihiko': （漢字表記を加えました。）記紀→"Kojiki" (A Record of Ancient Matter) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan)（既出の場合はthe Kojiki and the Nihonshokiとしました。）
sen.e: KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko (Sotsuhiko can be written as either '襲津彦' or '曽都毘古' in Japanese, and his first name, Sotsuhiko, is also known as Sachihiko written as 沙至比跪 in Japanese; year of birth and death unknown, but considered to have lived during a period from the latter fourth century to the early fifth century) was described in the "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as the founder of Katsuragi clan, ancient local ruling family in the Katsuragi region, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 祖→founder（「設立者」の意味であるので、用語集に合わせました。）
sen.e: KATSURAGI no Sotsuhiko (Sotsuhiko can be written as either '襲津彦' or '曽都毘古' in Japanese, and his first name, Sotsuhiko, is also known as Sachihiko written as 沙至比跪 in Japanese; year of birth and death unknown, but considered to have lived during a period from the latter fourth century to the early fifth century) was described in the "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as the founder of Katsuragi clan, ancient local ruling family in the Katsuragi region, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 編年がほぼ正しく同時代史料が元となったと考えられる百済三書のひとつ、百済記にその名が見えるので、実在の可能性が高い。
sen.e: His name also appears in "Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche), which is one of the three books of Paekche (Original Records of Paekche, Records of Paekche, and The New Selection of Paekche) and considered to have been compliled and shared the same historical source with the Kojiki and the Nihonshoki, therefore, it is highly probable that he really existed

There is a high probability that he really existed because his name appears in "Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche), one of three books of Paekche (Original Records of Paekche, Records of Paekche, and The New Selection of Paekche), whose chronology was almost accurate and which are considered to have been compiled based on historical materials in the same period.
sen.cmt: 英語らしい表現にするため、結論、理由の順に訳を変更しました。編年→chronology
sen.e: There is a high probability that he really existed because his name appears in "Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche), one of three books of Paekche (Original Records of Paekche, Records of Paekche, and The New Selection of Paekche), whose chronology was almost accurate and which are considered to have been compiled based on historical materials in the same period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神功皇后 摂政五年の春三月の癸卯の朔己酉(7日）に初めて襲津彦の記述がある。
sen.e: His first appearance in a written material can be found in a document dated on the day of Mizunoto-u no Tsuchinoto-tori (the seventh day) of the third month, spring, of the fifth year of the Empress Jingu's reign as follows:.
sen.cmt: 神功皇后 摂政五年の春三月→the third month, spring, of the fifth year of the Empress Jingu's reignとしました。癸卯の朔己酉(7日）→the day of Mizunoto-u no Tsuchinoto-tori (the seventh day)としました。
sen.e: The following description of Sotsuhiko first appeared in a document dated March 7, 205 in old calendar.
sen.cmt: 神功皇后 摂政五年の春三月の癸卯の朔己酉(7日）→March 7, 205（「神功皇后 摂政五年」は、205年となり（Wikipedia「神功皇后」より）、また、春三月の癸卯の朔己酉は、"(7日）"の表記があるので、3月7日（旧暦）として表記しました。）
sen.e: The following description of Sotsuhiko first appeared in a document dated March 7, 205 in old calendar.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 新羅王の質、微叱旱岐（みしこち）の見張りとして襲津彦を新羅に使わすが、対馬にて新羅王の使者に騙され微叱旱岐に逃げられた。
sen.e: Sotsuhiko was dispatched to Silla as a watchdog of Prince Mishikochi, who was rendered as hostage by King of Silla, however, on the way back to convoy the prince, he was cheated by a messenger of King of Silla in Tsushima Island, and let Prince Mishikochi get away. Then, Sotsuhiko, who got angry, attacked Kusawaranosashi Castle approaching from Tataratsu and brought a captive back.
sen.cmt: 質→hostageとしました。微叱旱岐（みしこち）→Prince Mishikochiとしました。見張り→watchdogとしました。草羅城（くさわらのさし)→Kusawaranosashi Castleとしました。
sen.e: Although he was dispatched to Silla as a watchdog of Prince Mishikochi who was rendered as hostage by the King of Silla, Sotsuhiko was deceived by an envoy dispatched by the King of Silla and allowed Prince Mishikochi to escape at Tsushima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although he was dispatched to Silla as a watchdog of Prince Mishikochi who was rendered as hostage by the King of Silla, Sotsuhiko was deceived by an envoy dispatched by the King of Silla and allowed Prince Mishikochi to escape at Tsushima.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 怒った襲津彦が蹈鞴津（たたらつ）から草羅城（くさわらのさし）を攻撃して捕虜を連れ帰った。
sen.e: Sotsuhiko who got angry attacked Kusawaranosashi Castle from Tataratsu, and brought a captive back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処"who"の前のカンマを削除し、ピリオドの前のスペースを1つ削除しました。
sen.e: Sotsuhiko who got angry attacked Kusawaranosashi Castle from Tataratsu, and brought a captive back.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神功皇后 摂政六十二年 襲津彦を遣わして新羅を撃たせる。
sen.e: In the 62nd year of Empress Jingu's reign, Empress Jingu dispatched Sotsuhiko to defeat Shilla Kingdom.
sen.cmt: 神功皇后 摂政六十二年→the 62nd year of Empress Jingu's reignとしました。新羅→Silla Kingdom（Kingdomを入れました。）
sen.e: In 262, Sotsuhiko was dispatched to defeat the Shilla Kingdom.
sen.cmt: 神功皇后 摂政六十二年→262（Wikipedia「神功皇后」より）襲津彦を主語にしました。
sen.e: In 262, Sotsuhiko was dispatched to defeat the Shilla Kingdom.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （『百済記』が伝えるところ、貴国は沙至比跪（さちひこ、襲津彦）を使って新羅を撃たせようとしたが、沙至比跪は新羅の美女に心を奪われ矛先を伽耶に向け、加羅を滅ぼしてしまう。）
sen.e: (According to the "Records of Paekche, 'Kikoku (Japan) tried to defeat Silla Kingdom using Sachihiko (Sotsuhiko), however, Sachihiko was fascinated by a Silla's beautiful girl, and he changed his target of attack to Kaya (a confederacy of territorial polities in the Nakdong River basin of South Korea) and destroyed Kaya.
sen.cmt: 貴国→Kikoku (Japan)（当時の日本は「貴国」呼ばれる場合があったのでこのように修正しました）。沙至比跪→Sachihiko (Sotsuhiko)（（）内を加え同一人物だということを示しました。）伽耶→the confederacy of Kaya（Gayaとも読むようです。）1) 英語表記：Kaya [www.britanika.com/Ebchecked/topic/313689/Kaya]2) 英語表記：Gaya, confederacy of territorial polities in the Nakdong River basin of South Korea [www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2010/…/116_62891.html]加羅→Kaya（Gayaとも読むようです。）
sen.e: (The "Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche) told that although 'Kikoku (Japan) tried to defeat the Silla Kingdom using Sachihiko (Sotsuhiko), Sachihiko who was fascinated by a beautiful girl in Silla, turned his target of attack to Kaya (a confederacy of territorial polities in the Nakdong River basin of South Korea) and destroyed Kaya.)
sen.cmt: 『百済記』→"Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche)（原文に従い、"Kudaraki"を表記しました。）
sen.e: (The "Kudaraki" (Records of Paekche) told that although 'Kikoku (Japan) tried to defeat the Silla Kingdom using Sachihiko (Sotsuhiko), Sachihiko who was fascinated by a beautiful girl in Silla, turned his target of attack to Kaya (a confederacy of territorial polities in the Nakdong River basin of South Korea) and destroyed Kaya.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （百済に逃げた加羅王家は天皇に直訴し、天皇は木羅斤資（もくらこんし）を使わし沙至比跪を攻めさせる。）
sen.e: The royal family of Kaya that escaped to Paekche Kingdom appealed directly to the Emperor, and the Emperor sent Mokurakonshi to attack 'Sachihiko'
(The royal family of Kaya that escaped to Paekche appealed directly to the Emperor, and the Emperor sent Mokurakonshi to attack Sachihiko.)
sen.cmt: 百済→Paekche（王国と記載されていないので、Kingdomは、削除しました。）沙至比跪→Sachihiko（クォーテーション・マーク（' '）は、特に必要ないので、削除しました。）
sen.e: (The royal family of Kaya that escaped to Paekche appealed directly to the Emperor, and the Emperor sent Mokurakonshi to attack Sachihiko.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （沙至比跪は天皇の怒りが収まらないことを知ると自殺した。）
sen.e: 'Sachihiko' killed himself to recognize that the emperor's anger would not be calmed down.)
sen.cmt: カッコ「）」を下列から移動しました。沙至比跪→Sachihiko天皇→the emperor
sen.e: (Sachihiko who found that the emperor's anger would not be calmed killed himself.)
sen.cmt: "to recognize ～"の部分は、原文の意味に沿っていないので、全体を変更しました。
sen.e: (Sachihiko who found that the emperor's anger would not be calmed killed himself.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応神天皇 十四年 百済の弓月君（ゆつきのきみ）が誉田天皇に対し、百済の民人を連れて帰化したいけれども新羅が邪魔をして加羅から海を渡ってくることができないことを告げる。
sen.e: In 応神天皇 十四年the 14th year of the era of Emperor Ojin, 百済の弓月君(ゆつきのきみ)Yutsuki no kimi of Kudara informed the 誉田天皇Emperor Homuda (Emperor Ojin) that he would like to go to Japan taking the people of Paekche to nationalize themselves in Japan, however, Silla was impeding them to cross the sea from 加羅Kaya (Gaya).
sen.cmt: 誉田天皇→Emperor Homuda (Emperor Ojin)（誉田天皇は応神天皇の別名なのでこのように修正しました。）
sen.e: In 283, Yutsuki no kimi of Kudara told the Emperor Homuda (Emperor Ojin) that although he would like to take the people of Paekche and to nationalize themselves including himself, he could not cross the sea from Kaya due to disturbances by Silla.
sen.cmt: 応神天皇 十四年→In 283（Wikipedia「応神天皇」を参照しました。） 漢字表記は、特に必要ないので、全て削除しました。
sen.e: In 283, Yutsuki no kimi of Kudara told the Emperor Homuda (Emperor Ojin) that although he would like to take the people of Paekche and to nationalize themselves including himself, he could not cross the sea from Kaya due to disturbances by Silla.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天皇は襲津彦を加羅に遣わして百済の民を連れ帰るように命令するが、三年なんの音沙汰もなくなった。
sen.e: The Emperor sent Sotsuhiko to Kaya (Gaya), ordering him to bring the people of Paekche to Japan, however, the Emperor heard nothing from him during three years since then.
Although the Emperor ordered Sotsuhiko to go to Kaya and bring the people of Paekche to Japan, the Emperor heard nothing from him for three years.
sen.cmt: （命令する）が、→Although（"Although"で始まる文章に変更しました。）文章を簡潔にする目的で、"order"（命令する）を「遣わす」にも使用するため、「～遣わす」を"order to go to ～"としました。
sen.e: Although the Emperor ordered Sotsuhiko to go to Kaya and bring the people of Paekche to Japan, the Emperor heard nothing from him for three years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 応神天皇 十六年八月、天皇は平群木菟宿禰（へぐりのつくのすくね）・的戸田宿禰（いくはのとだのすくね）に「襲津彦が帰ってこないのはきっと新羅が邪魔をしているのに違いない、加羅に赴いて襲津彦を助けろ」といって、加羅に兵を派遣した。
sen.e: In the eighth month of the 16th year of the era of Emperor Ojin, the Emperor said to Heguri no sukune and Ikuhanotoda no sukune, 'I am sure that [t]he reason why Sotsuhiko hasn't come back is because Silla is impeding him, go to Kaya and rescue Sotsuhiko,' and dispatched soldiers.
sen.cmt: 応神天皇 十六年八月→the eighth month of the 16th year of the era of Emperor Ojinとしました。
sen.e: In August 285 in old calendar, the Emperor said to Hegurinotsuku no sukune and Ikuhanotoda no sukune, 'Go to Kaya and rescue Sotsuhiko because I'm sure that Silla disturbs his return,' and dispatched soldiers to Kaya.
sen.cmt: 応神天皇 十六年八月→August 285 in old calendar（Wikipedia「応神天皇」には、「年」は記載されておりますが、「月」は記載されていないので、旧暦と表記しました。） 平群木菟宿禰→Hegurinotsuku no sukune（（へぐりのつくのすくね）と読み方が記載されているので、この読み方に従いました。）加羅に兵を派遣した→dispatched soldiers to Kaya（「加羅」が訳抜けしていました。）
sen.e: In August 285 in old calendar, the Emperor said to Hegurinotsuku no sukune and Ikuhanotoda no sukune, 'Go to Kaya and rescue Sotsuhiko because I'm sure that Silla disturbs his return,' and dispatched soldiers to Kaya.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 新羅の王はその軍勢に怖じけづいて逃げ帰った。
sen.e: The King of Silla, who was frightened to see the troops, fled back home.
The King of Silla who got frightened by the troops fled back to Silla.
sen.cmt: 逃げ帰った→fled back to Silla（「新羅に逃げ帰る」の意味なので、変更しました。）
sen.e: The King of Silla who got frightened by the troops fled back to Silla.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そして襲津彦はやっと弓月氏の民を連れて帰国した。
sen.e: Then, Sotsuhiko finally returned back bringing the people of the Yutsuki clan
Then, Sotsuhiko finally returned back with the people of the Yutsuki clan.
sen.cmt: 連れて→with（"with"の方が簡潔なので、変更しました。）文尾にピリオドを付けました。
sen.e: Then, Sotsuhiko finally returned back with the people of the Yutsuki clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 仁徳天皇 四十一年三月 紀角宿禰（きのつのすくね）に無礼をはたらいた百済の王族の酒君（さけのきみ）を、百済王が襲津彦を使って天皇のところへ連行させる。
sen.e: In the third month of the 41st year of the era of Emperor Nintoku, the King of Paekche made Sotsuhiko take in Sake no kimi, one of the royal family members of the Paekche Kingdom, who acted disrespectfully to Kinotsu no sukune, and turn him over to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 仁徳天皇 四十一年三月 →the third month of the 41st year of the era of Emperor Nintokuとしました。
sen.e: In March 353 in old calendar, the King of Paekche ordered Sotsuhiko to take Sake no kimi, one of the royal family members of the Paekche Kingdom, who was rude to Kinotsu no sukune, to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 仁徳天皇 四十一年三月→March 353 in old calendar（Wikipedia「仁徳天皇」には、「年」は記載されておりますが、「月」は記載されていないので、旧暦と表記しました。） ＡをＢのところに連行する→take A to B（簡潔な表現に変更しました。）
sen.e: In March 353 in old calendar, the King of Paekche ordered Sotsuhiko to take Sake no kimi, one of the royal family members of the Paekche Kingdom, who was rude to Kinotsu no sukune, to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
